newsitem.title: ESTONIA: HANSAPANK LATVIJA ASSETS RISE 17 PCT IN FEB.
newsitem.headline: HANSAPANK LATVIJA ASSETS RISE 17 PCT IN FEB.

text.p: Hansapank Latvija, a subsidiary of Hansapank, said on Tuesday that its total assets rose to 61.9 million lats in February compared to January's 52.9 million lats.
Total assets increased by 17 percent or 9.0 million lats, Hansapank said in a statement.
Hansapank said that a significant source of growth was in deposits, which increased by 20.7 percent, or by 7.3 million lats, to reach 42.6 million lats during February.
Amounts owing from other financial institutions increased the subsidiary's assets by 9.0 million lats to 19.7 million lats, the bank said.
Hansapank Latvija's loans increased its assets from January's 12.2 million lats up to 12.4 million lats February.
The bank's time deposits increased from 5.8 million to 6.3 million lats in February.
